segments.en: Linked Discourses 14
2. The Second Chapter
15. Walking Meditation

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was walking meditation together with several mendicants not far from the Buddha.

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho mahāmoggallāno sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was doing likewise, as were

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho mahākassapo sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Venerable Mahākassapa,

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho anuruddho sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Venerable Anuruddha,

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho puṇṇo mantāniputto sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Venerable Puṇṇa Mantāniputta,

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho upāli sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Venerable Upāli,

segments.pli: āyasmāpi kho ānando sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati;
segments.en: Venerable Ānanda,

segments.pli: devadattopi kho sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhagavato avidūre caṅkamati.
segments.en: and Devadatta.
Then the Buddha said to the mendicants,

segments.pli: “passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, sāriputtaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: “Mendicants, do you see Sāriputta walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants have great wisdom.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, moggallānaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Moggallāna walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants have great psychic power.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, kassapaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Kassapa walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants advocate austerities.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, anuruddhaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Anuruddha walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants have clairvoyance.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, puṇṇaṃ mantāniputtaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Puṇṇa Mantāniputta walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants are Dhamma speakers.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, upāliṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Upāli walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants are experts in monastic training.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, ānandaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Ānanda walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants are very learned.

segments.pli: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, devadattaṃ sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ caṅkamantan”ti?
segments.en: Do you see Devadatta walking meditation together with several mendicants?”
“Yes, sir.”
“All of those mendicants have bad desires.
Sentient beings come together and converge because of an element.
Those who have a bad attitude come together and converge with those who have a bad attitude.
Those who have a good attitude come together and converge with those who have a good attitude.

segments.pli: Atītampi kho, bhikkhave, addhānaṃ dhātusova sattā saṃsandiṃsu samiṃsu.
segments.en: In the past,

segments.pli: Anāgatampi kho, bhikkhave, addhānaṃ dhātusova sattā saṃsandissanti samessanti.
segments.en: in the future,

segments.pli: Etarahipi kho, bhikkhave, paccuppannaṃ addhānaṃ dhātusova sattā saṃsandanti samenti.
segments.en: and also in the present, sentient beings come together and converge because of an element.
Those who have a bad attitude come together and converge with those who have a bad attitude.
Those who have a good attitude come together and converge with those who have a good attitude.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha points out that each of the great disciples has a retinue of students of a similar character. And the monks in Devadattas’s retinue all have evil wishes.
